Bank promotions generally consist of cash bonuses when you open a new checking or savings account. These are one-time perks. To qualify, youll likely have to set up direct deposit with the bank and keep the account open for at least a few months. As we approach 2026, checking account bonus offers could land you between $100 and $3,000.

The best bank promotions today are checking account bonuses:

  • Chase Secure Banking: $100 bonus with no minimum direct deposit required.

  • Chase Total Checking: $300 bonus with $500 minimum direct deposit required.

  • TD Complete Checking: $200 bonus with $500 minimum direct deposit required.

Weve rounded up additional excellent checking account bonuses and savings account promotions below. Check out the details on these offers to determine the best fit.

  • Summary of best bank promotions and bonuses

    Best checking account bonus offers

    Consider the best checking account bonuses from large national banks as well as online banks.

    • Bank of America Advantage Plus Banking: Up to $500 bonus offer

    • BMO checking: $400 bonus offer*

    • Capital One 360 Checking: $250 bonus offer

    • Chase Private Client Checking: Up to $3,000 bonus offer

    • Chase Secure Banking: $100 bonus offer

    • Chase Total Checking: $300 bonus offer

    • Chime Checking Account: Up to $350 bonus offer

    • Citi checking with direct deposit: $325 bonus offer

    • E*TRADE Max-Rate Checking: $300 bonus offer

    • KeyBank Key Smart Checking: $300 bonus offer

    • TD Bank checking: Up to $300 bonus offer

    • U.S. Bank Smartly Checking: Up to $450 bonus offer (only available in select states/regions)

    • Wells Fargo Everyday Checking: $325 bonus offer

    Best bank bonus for business checking

    See our pick for the best business checking account bonus.

    • Chase business checking: Up to $500 bonus offer

    Best bank bonuses for checking and savings

    Choose from a couple combination checking-and-savings account bonuses.

    • PNC Bank Virtual Wallet with Performance Select: Up to $400 bonus offer

    • SoFi Checking and Savings: Up to $300 bonus offer

    Best bank bonuses for savings

    The top savings account bonuses offer cash rewards on top of competitive APYs.

    • TD Bank savings: $200 bonus offer (only available in select states/regions)

  • Our pick for

    Combination rewards-checking-and-savings account bonus

    • SoFi Checking and Savings
      Learn moreon partner's site
      at SoFi Bank, N.A., Member FDIC
      NerdWallet rating
      4.8/5
      Learn moreon partner's site
      at SoFi Bank, N.A., Member FDIC

      APY

      1.00%

      With $0 min. balance for APY

      Bonus

      $50 or $300

      Earn $50 or $300 with eligible direct deposit. Terms apply.

      Our Take
      Why We Like It

      This offer is our top pick for a sign-up bonus for a combined checking and savings account.

      If youre looking for a combination checking-and-savings account, this bonus is a standout. It offers a couple different tiers to earn a cash bonus of either $50 or $300 (the bonus amount differs based on the amount you direct deposit). In addition to a solid cash bonus offering, the savings account pays a competitive interest rate much higher than whats offered by other savings accounts on our list when you meet requirements.

      What you'll get: $50 or $300.

      Expiration: 01/31/2026.

      How to get it: Open a new SoFi Checking and Savings account on the offer page. Make at least one eligible direct deposit before the promotion expiration date. Deposit $1,000 to $4,999.99 to earn a $50 bonus; deposit $5,000 or more to earn a $300 bonus.

      Where to open: Online.

      Who can qualify: Customers who open a new SoFi Checking and Savings account.

      When youll get it: Within seven business days after the 25-day Direct Deposit Bonus Period following the receipt of the first qualifying direct deposit.

      Monthly fee: $0.

      What you'll get: $325.

      Expiration: 01/14/2026.

Throughout this time, your account must remain open with a balance greater than $0.

      Where to open: Online or in a branch.

      Who can qualify: You must not currently have a Wells Fargo consumer checking account or have received a bonus for opening one within the last 12 months or you are a Wells Fargo employee.

      Why We Like It

      This Chase offer is our top pick for checking account bonus because of how accessible it is: It doesnt require a huge deposit and it allows up to three months to meet the direct deposit requirement.

      The Total Checking bank bonus is one of the best checking account bonus offers available. Compared with similar offers on our list, youll get a large bonus compared with the direct deposit requirement. You can earn the Total Checking account bonus by meeting a minimum direct deposit requirement within 90 days.

      What you'll get: $300.

      Expiration: 01/21/2026.

      How to get it: Open a Chase Total Checking account online or in person using a coupon emailed to you through the promotional page. You must make at least $500 in direct deposits into the account within 90 days of opening the account.

      Where to open: The checking account can be opened online or at a Chase branch (find a location near you).

      Who can qualify: New Chase checking account customers. You must not have had a Chase checking account within the last 90 days or had one closed with a negative balance within the last three years. In addition, you may receive only one new checking account opening bonus every two years from the last enrollment date, and youre limited to one bonus per account.

      When youll get it: The checking account bonus will be deposited into your account within 15 days after your first direct deposit.

      Monthly fee: Can be waived; see bank site for details.

      Learn more: Get more details about Chase checking account bonuses

      This bonus stands out for rewarding you if you set up a direct deposit as low as $500 a much lower deposit requirement than that of other offers on our list. A tiered bonus is available, so if you meet the significantly larger minimum deposit requirement, you can earn $400.

      What you'll get: $100 or $400.

      Expiration: 01/05/2026.

      How to get it: Open a Virtual Wallet or Virtual Wallet with Performance Select account on the offer page or by bringing a coupon to a branch and receive a total of at least $500 or $5,000 in qualifying direct deposits, respectively, within 60 days of opening the account. Opening a Virtual Wallet account and meeting the criteria will earn you $100 while opening a Virtual Wallet with Performance Select account and meeting the criteria will earn you $400.

      Where to open: Online or at a branch.

      Who can qualify: Anyone who does not currently have a PNC checking account, and has not closed a PNC account within the past 12 months or received a PNC promotional payment within the last 24 months. Availability may vary by your location; you can check your eligibility on the website.

      When youll get it: The bonus will be credited to your account, which must be open, within 60-90 days after youve met the requirements.

      Monthly fee: Can be waived; see bank site for details.

      Our Take
      Why We Like It

      This bonus offer is unique as it rewards you for opening (and direct depositing into) your choice of eligible checking account at one of the largest banks in the U.S. You can choose to try and earn the cash bonus with one of three different accounts. This bank bonus is smaller and takes longer to be paid compared with other offers on our list, but requirements are straightforward.

      What you'll get: Up to $500 cash offer.

      Expiration: 01/31/2026.

      How to get it: Open a new eligible Bank of America Advantage Banking checking account through the Bank of America promotional page. Meet deposit requirements, including receiving Qualifying Direct Deposits* totaling $2,000 or more within 90 days of opening the eligible account. To earn $100 receive a total of at least $2,000, to earn $300 receive a total of at least $5,000 and to earn $500 receive a total of $10,0000 or more. Note that Bank of America Advantage SafeBalance Banking for Family Banking accounts are not eligible for the offer). Your checking account must be open and in good standing to receive the bonus. Additional terms and conditions apply. See offer page for more details. Bank of America says: *A Qualifying Direct Deposit is a direct deposit of regular monthly income such as your salary, pension or Social Security benefits, which are made by your employer or other payer using account and routing numbers that you provide to them.

      Where to open: Online only.

      Who can qualify: This is an online-only offer for new checking account customers only. Bank of America says: You are not eligible for this offer if you were an owner or co-owner of a Bank of America personal checking account within the last twelve (12) months.

      When youll get it: Bank of America says: Once all requirements are met, Bank of America will attempt to pay bonus within 60 days.

      Monthly maintenance fee: Can be waived; see bank site for details.

More information about bank bonuses, checking account bonuses, and savings account bonuses

Here's the most important thing to consider:

The best bank bonus is one that rewards you for using a bank account to manage your money in a way that works for you. The account should have the features that matter most to you. That may be a high APY, a large network of branches or ATMs, or low or no fees.

MORE: Read about the best and worst things about new account bonus offers

What does the Fed rate announcement mean for bank account bonuses?

In December, the Federal Reserve announced that it would again lower the federal funds rate. That's the rate which commercial banks use to borrow and lend money to one another.

This was the third time in 2025 that the rate changed. The Fed also lowered the rate three times in late 2024 after increasing the rate four times in 2023 and seven times in 2022.

The changes havent directly affected bank bonuses, but it could still be a good time to open a new bank account in case savings account interest rates fall. So you could take advantage of both a bank bonus and current APYs in a new savings account.

MORE: See what the Fed rate means for savings accounts

Are bank account bonuses worth it?

Bank promotions can be worth the effort if the reward is substantial enough and the requirements aren't difficult to meet. It's important to understand the full details before signing up for a new account to earn a bank bonus. That includes what fees might be incurred and how long you might have to wait for the bonus to be paid.

If earning a bank sign-up bonus requires depositing more than $250,000 (which is the standard amount thats insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp.), youll need to employ certain strategies to make sure that all your money including funds over $250,000 is protected.

More Nerdy Perspective

"A cash bonus is appealing, but many checking accounts dont earn interest, so you could miss out on thousands of dollars (much more than the maximum bonus) which you could earn by putting that money in a high-yield savings account instead. What's more, earning the highest bonus amount offered on this list requires at least $500,000. Depositing more than $250,000 would put you over Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. coverage limits, so youd need to consider a strategy to protect all your money."

Ruth Sarreal

Check out more things to look out for when considering a bank sign-up bonus.

Prefer an account that offers rewards beyond a sign-up bonus? Check out our favorite rewards checking accounts

What do the best bank bonuses have in common?

The best bank promotions offer a significant cash bonus in exchange for signing up for a new account with no fees or easily avoided fees. The best bank bonuses for you are ones that have requirements you're comfortable with, including the amount of time you'll have to keep your money in the account to earn the bonus.

Are bank bonuses taxable?

If youve earned a cash bonus for opening a new bank account, it's usually taxable. You are responsible for covering any tax liability. Learn more about taxes on bank bonuses.

Churning through accounts to get bonuses? Find out whether closing a bank account hurts your credit

Should I have more than one checking or savings account?

It can be helpful to have multiple bank accounts. Just be sure you can meet the requirements and minimums in order to avoid fees.

The number of checking and/or savings accounts you should have will depend on a few factors. Married or partnered people might each want to have their own accounts in addition to one or more shared accounts. You might want to consider having accounts at different financial institutions for different purposes such as having an account with a bank that works well for international travel if youre frequently abroad, or with the bank that handles your mortgage or other loans for more seamless payment transfers. (Learn the pros and cons of keeping multiple bank accounts at different banks.)

Looking for the right place to keep your savings? Check out NerdWallet's picks for the best savings accounts

Why dont you feature other bank account bonuses?

You may find other banks and new account sign-up offers that are not featured on this page. Associated Bank, Fifth Third Bank, Huntington Bank and other financial institutions offer checking account bonuses and promotions but arent included in our roundup, for example. Thats because we curate a list thats limited to what our experts think are the very best options for our readers. We dont make recommendations for bank accounts that dont earn fair or better ratings from us, no matter how big the bonus may be. And we dont make recommendations for bonuses in amounts that wouldnt be worth the effort.

Methodology

We took a close look at around 100 financial institutions and financial service providers, including the largest U.S. banks based on assets, internet search traffic and other factors; the nations largest credit unions, based on assets and membership; and other notable and/or emerging players in the industry.
